subject: RE: [junit] passing arguments to TestRunner?
msgSnippet: forgive a novice-sounding question, but doesn t this still involve hardcoding, just a properties filename instead of a test data filename? ... From: Robert
messageBody:
forgive a novice-sounding question, but doesn't this still involve
hardcoding, just a properties filename instead of a test data filename?

-----Original Message-----
From: Robert Sartin [mailto:sartin@...]
Sent: Tuesday, February 06, 2001 11:56 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] passing arguments to TestRunner?



--- Andy Kriger <akriger@...> wrote:
>However, I still have to hardcode the name of the data file.

Perhaps this would be a good place to use Java Properties?

Regards,

Rob
